meanings.definition: To give notice or warning to
meanings.sent1: Please awarn me before you arrive at my house.
meanings.sent2: I will awarn you about the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to awarn the birds about the approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse's beam awarned sailors of the dangerous rocks ahead.
meanings.sent5: The smoke alarm's loud sound awarned us of the fire in the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: She will awarn her friend about the change in plans.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will awarn the students about the test next week.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot likes to awarn visitors about the dog in the house.
meanings.sent4: The ringing phone awarned her of an incoming call.
meanings.sent5: The news bulletin awarned the public of the severe weather approaching.

meanings.definition: To make aware or conscious of something
meanings.sent1: The signs will awarn hikers of the steep cliff ahead.
meanings.sent2: He tried to awarn his brother about the dangers of swimming alone.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder awarned the children of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence awarned her of a possible intruder in the house.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's diagnosis awarned him of the seriousness of his condition.
